ground_truth: The car coasts silently to a stop in front of the Robinson house. They sit there for a long time without saying anything, Ben's hand touching her shoulder. There is a squeal of tires as Ben almost drives off the road. Ben and Elaine enter the lobby and stand just inside the door. They start in a few steps. One of the car parkers passes them on his way out. The camera begins to pull up and away. A bellboy passes them. The room clerk smiles at them. Ben and Elaine stop a few feet into the center of the lobby. The camera pulls back to a high overhead shot revealing many people moving back and forth in the lobby, passing Ben and Elaine. Ben brings Elaine through the door to the porch. Ben and Elaine are in his car. He takes his hand off the ignition, jams on the accelerator, and drives the car speedily for twenty-one feet and jams on the brakes. He turns off the ignition and the lights. He puts his head down on the steering wheel. He lifts his head. She nods. He turns the key in the ignition and starts the car. He freezes with his hand still on the key. He turns off the engine. He starts the car and drives out. It is raining. On the seat beside Ben is a package. From the way it is wrapped, we can tell it is a gift. Ben's right hand is on it as he drives past Ben and through the windshield as the Robinson house comes closer and closer. The front door of the Robinson house opens and Mrs. Robinson comes out, dressed in a housecoat, and, in four or five fast steps, reaches the car, opens the door on the passenger side, and climbs in. Ben starts the car forward down the driveway as they drive. Ben stops the car in front of a house halfway down the block. There is a pause while Ben looks at her expression. Then he grabs the keys out of the ignition, opens the door on his side, and jumps out of the car, carrying the package. Track with Ben as he runs up the street and up the driveway toward the Robinson house. Ben gets to the front door. Ben runs up the stairs. He still carries the package. Ben gets to the top just as Elaine comes out of the door to her bedroom. She is wearing a skirt and slip and carrying one shoe. Ben pushes her back into her room. Ben turns and looks. Mrs. Robinson is just entering the house. He holds her against the wall in the corner. Back in the corner.

Ben and Elaine enter the foyer and stand just inside the entrance. They proceed a few paces. One of the automobile attendants passes them on his way out. The camera starts to pull up and away. A bellhop passes them. The room receptionist smiles at them. Ben and Elaine pause a few feet into the center of the foyer. The camera pulls back to a high overhead shot revealing many individuals moving back and forth in the foyer, passing Ben and Elaine. Ben brings Elaine through the entrance to the veranda. Ben and Elaine are in his vehicle. He removes his hand from the ignition, presses on the accelerator, and drives the vehicle quickly for twenty-one feet and presses on the brakes. He turns off the ignition and the lights. He rests his head on the steering wheel. He raises his head. She nods. He turns the key in the ignition and starts the vehicle. He freezes with his hand still on the key. He turns off the engine. He starts the vehicle and drives away. It is raining. On the seat beside Ben is a parcel. From the way it is wrapped, we can tell it is a present. Ben's right hand is on it as he drives past Ben and through the windshield as the Robinson residence comes closer and closer. The front entrance of the Robinson residence opens and Mrs. Robinson emerges, dressed in a housecoat, and, in four or five rapid steps, reaches the vehicle, opens the door on the passenger side, and climbs in. Ben starts the vehicle forward down the driveway as they proceed. Ben halts the vehicle in front of a residence halfway down the street. There is a pause while Ben observes her expression. Then he grabs the keys from the ignition, opens the door on his side, and leaps out of the vehicle, carrying the parcel. Track with Ben as he runs up the street and up the driveway toward the Robinson residence. Ben reaches the front entrance. Ben runs up the stairs. He still carries the parcel. Ben arrives at the top just as Elaine emerges from the entrance to her bedroom. She is wearing a skirt and slip and carrying one shoe. Ben pushes her back into her room. Ben turns and looks. Mrs. Robinson is just entering the residence. He holds her against the wall in the corner. Back in the corner.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The car silently stops in front of the Robinson house. Ben and Elaine sit silently, with his hand on her shoulder. Suddenly, Ben almost drives off the road. They enter a busy lobby and pause as people pass by; a room clerk smiles. Ben and Elaine move to the porch, then return to his car, where he drives quickly before stopping abruptly. He rests his head on the steering wheel, then starts the car. As it rains, a gift-wrapped package sits beside him. Mrs. Robinson, in a housecoat, gets into the car, and they drive off. Ben stops halfway down the block, exits with the package, and runs to the Robinson house. He reaches the door, ascends the stairs, and meets Elaine, who is in a skirt and slip. He pushes her into her room as Mrs. Robinson enters the house, holding Elaine against the wall in the corner.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The car silently stops at the Robinson house. Ben's hand touches her shoulder as they sit quietly. Tires squeal as Ben almost veers off the road. Ben and Elaine enter the lobby, stand inside, and start walking as a car parker and bellboy pass by. The room clerk smiles. The camera reveals a bustling lobby before Ben brings Elaine to the porch. In the car, Ben accelerates, brakes, and turns off the ignition, resting his head on the wheel. He starts the car amid rain; a package beside him indicates a gift. As they approach the Robinson house, Mrs. Robinson, in a housecoat, enters the car. Ben drives, pauses, then jumps out with the package, runs to the house, and ascends the stairs, meeting Elaine in a skirt and slip. He pushes her into her room and looks as Mrs. Robinson enters the house, holding her against the wall.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The car moves forward quietly and comes to a smooth halt right in front of the Robinson's residence. They remain seated there for a prolonged period, enveloped in silence, with Ben's hand resting gently on her shoulder. Suddenly, there is a loud squeal of tires as Ben nearly veers off the road. Once safely inside, Ben and Elaine make their way into the lobby and stand just within the entrance. They take a few steps forward. As they do, one of the car parkers walks by them, heading on his way out. The camera begins to slowly pull upward and away. A bellboy passes by them. The room clerk offers them a welcoming smile. Ben and Elaine come to a stop several feet into the very center of the expansive lobby. The camera elegantly pulls back to reveal a high overhead shot, showing numerous people bustling back and forth within the lobby, passing by Ben and Elaine. Ben leads Elaine through the door out onto the porch. They are now back inside his car. Ben removes his hand from the ignition, presses down forcefully on the accelerator, and drives the car rapidly forward for a brief distance of twenty-one feet before slamming on the brakes. He then turns off the ignition and the car's lights. He lowers his head onto the steering wheel for a moment before lifting it again. She nods in response. He inserts the key into the ignition and starts the car once more. He pauses momentarily, frozen with his hand still on the key. After turning off the engine, he promptly starts the car again and drives away. Meanwhile, the rain begins to fall. On the seat next to Ben lies a package. From its careful wrapping, it is clear this package is intended as a gift. Ben's right hand rests on it while he drives, moving past Ben and through the windshield as the Robinson house draws nearer. The front door of the Robinson house opens, and Mrs. Robinson steps out, dressed in a housecoat. With four or five swift steps, she reaches the car, opens the door on the passenger side, and climbs in. As they proceed to drive away, Ben moves the car forward down the driveway. Ben halts the car in front of a house located midway down the block. He pauses to observe her expression closely. Then, he swiftly grabs the keys from the ignition, opens the door on his side, and quickly jumps out of the car, carrying the package with him. Tracking Ben, he sprints up the street and races up the driveway toward the Robinson residence. Ben arrives at the front door and hurriedly runs up the stairs, still clutching the package. Ben reaches the top just in time as Elaine emerges from the door to her bedroom. She is wearing a skirt and slip and is holding one shoe. Ben gently pushes her back into her room. Turning to look back, Ben sees Mrs. Robinson just entering the house. He keeps Elaine held against the wall in the corner. Both remain back in the corner.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The car smoothly advances forward, barely making a sound, and comes to a gentle, almost imperceptible stop right in front of the Robinson's impressive residential home. They sit quietly together for what feels like an extended period, wrapped in a shroud of silence, with Ben's reassuring hand resting softly yet firmly on her shoulder. Suddenly and unexpectedly, a loud squeal of tires pierces the quiet as Ben nearly steers off the road in a moment of alarm. Once they are safely ensconced inside, Ben and Elaine make their deliberate way into the spacious lobby, pausing just within the entrance as they gather themselves. They take several careful steps forward. As they proceed, one of the car parkers strides past them, making his way out. Gradually, the camera starts to pull back and ascend, capturing the scene. A bellboy moves by them at a brisk pace. The room clerk greets them with a cordial and welcoming smile. Ben and Elaine stop several feet into the central, expansive part of the lobby. The camera elegantly retreats to reveal a sweeping overhead shot, showcasing multitudes of people bustling energetically back and forth within the lobby, effortlessly streaming past Ben and Elaine. Ben then gently guides Elaine through the door leading out onto the porch. They find themselves once again inside his trusty car. Ben takes his hand off the ignition, pushes down firmly on the accelerator, and propels the car forward forcefully for a brief span of twenty-one feet before slamming the brakes to a definitive stop. He then turns off the ignition and extinguishes the car's lights. He lowers his head onto the steering wheel momentarily before raising it again. She nods in acknowledgment. He inserts the key back into the ignition and starts the car anew. He lingers momentarily, his hand still resting on the key in a moment of stillness. After another turn of the engine, he promptly starts the car once again and drives off. Meanwhile, the rain begins to fall, softly at first, then more insistently. On the seat beside Ben lies a carefully wrapped package, clearly intended as a thoughtful gift. Ben's right hand rests on it as he drives, moving past and peering through the windshield while the Robinson house gradually comes closer. The front door of the Robinson house swings open, and Mrs. Robinson emerges, clad in a comfortable housecoat. With four or five quick and determined steps, she reaches the car, opens the passenger side door, and climbs in with a sense of urgency. As they continue their drive, Ben moves the car smoothly down the driveway. Ben halts the vehicle in front of a house situated midway down the block. He pauses, taking a moment to carefully observe her expression. Then, with a swift motion, he grabs the keys from the ignition, swings the door open on his side, and nimbly jumps out of the car, the package securely in hand. As we track Ben, he sprints energetically up the street, racing up the driveway toward the Robinson residence with determination. Ben reaches the front door and hurriedly ascends the stairs, still clutching the package tightly. Ben reaches the top just in the nick of time as Elaine steps out from the door to her bedroom. She is dressed in a skirt and slip, holding one shoe in her hand. Ben gently urges her back into her room. Looking back, Ben sees Mrs. Robinson just as she is entering the house. He keeps Elaine held against the wall in the corner. Both linger in the corner, remaining out of sight.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The car silently glides to a complete stop in front of the Robinson house, with its occupants sitting quietly inside for an extended period as Ben's hand lightly rests on her shoulder, creating an intimate stillness. Suddenly, the silence is broken by the screech of tires as Ben momentarily loses control and veers off course. Regaining composure, Ben and Elaine make their way into the lobby, stepping just inside the entrance where they pause momentarily. They start to move further in, taking a few steps forward, when one of the car parkers briskly walks past them on his way out. As they stand there, the camera slowly begins to pull up and away, capturing the larger scene. A bellboy walks by them, adding to the bustling atmosphere, while the room clerk greets them with a smile. Ben and Elaine come to a stop a few feet into the center of the lobby, allowing the camera to pull back further, providing a high overhead shot that reveals the crowded lobby with many people moving to and fro around them. Ben gently guides Elaine through a door leading to the porch, transitioning smoothly from one environment to another. Inside Ben's car, he removes his hand from the ignition, suddenly presses down hard on the accelerator, then drives the car swiftly for a short distance before abruptly hitting the brakes to stop. He turns off the ignition and the lights before resting his head heavily on the steering wheel, a moment of introspection. Lifting his head, he glances at her, and she responds with a nod. He turns the key in the ignition to start the car, but freezes momentarily, his hand still gripping the key. He decides to turn off the engine again, hesitating briefly before starting the car once more and driving off. As they proceed, rain begins to fall, pattering against the car. Beside Ben on the seat is a package, easily identifiable as a gift by its wrapping. His right hand rests on the package as they drive, with the camera capturing the view through the windshield as they approach the Robinson house. The front door of the house swings open, and Mrs. Robinson emerges hurriedly, clad in a housecoat. She strides quickly towards the car, taking four or five brisk steps before reaching it, opening the passenger side door, and climbing in with urgency. Ben starts the car again, moving it forward down the driveway as they continue their journey. Soon, Ben halts the car in front of a house situated midway down the block. There's a moment of pause as Ben studies her expression closely. Without warning, he snatches the keys from the ignition, flings open his door, jumps out of the car, and clutches the package tightly. He then dashes energetically up the street and towards the Robinson house's driveway. Ben arrives at the front door and quickly ascends the stairs, still holding onto the package. As he reaches the top, Elaine emerges from her bedroom door, dressed in a skirt and slip, and carrying one shoe. In a swift motion, Ben pushes her gently but firmly back into her room. He spins around to look as Mrs. Robinson begins to enter the house. In a tense moment, he holds Elaine against the wall in the corner for a brief second, back in the corner.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The car coasts silently to a stop in front of the Robinson house, where Ben and Elaine sit quietly, Ben's hand resting on her shoulder. Suddenly, Ben almost drives off the road with a squeal of tires, but they regain composure and enter the lobby, standing near the door as people move around them. They pause briefly in the center before Ben leads Elaine to the porch. Back in the car, Ben accelerates briefly before stopping and resting his head on the wheel. After exchanging a nod with Elaine, he restarts the car and drives off. In the rain, a gift-wrapped package sits beside Ben as they approach the Robinson house. Mrs. Robinson, in a housecoat, quickly steps out to join him. They drive down the street before Ben stops the car, assesses Mrs. Robinson's expression, grabs the keys, and jumps out with the package. He runs to the Robinson house, dashes up the stairs, and reaches Elaine, who emerges from her room partially dressed. Ben pushes her back inside as Mrs. Robinson enters, and he holds Elaine in the corner, trying to keep her hidden.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The car, a sleek electric model known for its quiet operation, coasts silently to a stop in front of the Robinson house, an elegant colonial-style building distinguished by its well-manicured lawn. They sit there for a long time without saying anything, Ben's hand gently touching her shoulder in a comforting gesture reminiscent of their shared moments in college. There is a squeal of tires as Ben almost drives off the road, narrowly avoiding a collision on the rain-slicked pavement. Ben and Elaine enter the lobby of the Grand Haven Hotel, a historic site famed for its opulent chandeliers and marble floors, and stand just inside the door. They start in a few steps, taking in the grandeur. One of the car parkers, a young man hurrying to clock out after his shift, passes them on his way out. The camera begins to pull up and away, capturing the ornate ceiling designed by a renowned artisan. A bellboy, wearing a crisp uniform typical of the hotel's high standards, passes them. The room clerk, known for his warm and welcoming smile, acknowledges them. Ben and Elaine stop a few feet into the center of the lobby, taking a brief moment to absorb the bustling surroundings. The camera pulls back to a high overhead shot revealing many people moving back and forth in the lobby, like a dance of daily life, passing Ben and Elaine. Ben brings Elaine through the door to the porch, where the sounds of the city echo in the distance. Ben and Elaine are in his car, an old sedan with a perpetually dusty dashboard. He takes his hand off the ignition, jams on the accelerator, and drives the car speedily for twenty-one feet and jams on the brakes, causing the tires to screech against the asphalt. He turns off the ignition and the lights, plunging them into a shared moment of quiet. He puts his head down on the steering wheel, overwhelmed by a mix of emotions. He lifts his head. She nods, signaling her tacit agreement. He turns the key in the ignition and starts the car, the engine's low hum filling the space. He freezes with his hand still on the key, momentarily lost in thought. He turns off the engine again, contemplating their next move. He starts the car and drives out, merging carefully into the evening traffic. It is raining, the rhythmic patter of raindrops creating a soothing backdrop. On the seat beside Ben is a package, wrapped in elegant paper and tied with a ribbon, indicating it is a gift for someone special. Ben's right hand is on it as he drives, the weight of his decision mirrored in his grip. He drives past Ben and through the windshield as the Robinson house, a familiar landmark in the neighborhood, comes closer and closer. The front door of the Robinson house opens and Mrs. Robinson, known for her sharp wit and keen sense of style, comes out, dressed in a housecoat, and, in four or five fast steps, reaches the car, opens the door on the passenger side, and climbs in. Ben, driven by a sense of urgency, starts the car forward down the driveway as they drive. Ben stops the car in front of a house halfway down the block, a nondescript building with peeling paint and an overgrown garden. There is a pause while Ben looks at her expression, searching for a hint of understanding. Then he grabs the keys out of the ignition, opens the door on his side, and jumps out of the car, carrying the package with determination. Track with Ben as he runs up the street and up the driveway toward the Robinson house, his footsteps echoing his urgency. Ben gets to the front door, the familiar creak of the floorboards greeting him as he enters. Ben runs up the stairs, taking them two at a time. He still carries the package, its purpose clear in his mind. Ben gets to the top just as Elaine, who has been waiting anxiously, comes out of the door to her bedroom. She is wearing a skirt and slip and carrying one shoe, caught mid-preparation for an important meeting. Ben pushes her back into her room, his urgency overriding decorum. Ben turns and looks. Mrs. Robinson, having just entered the house, surveys the scene with a calculating gaze. He holds her against the wall in the corner, the tension between them palpable. Back in the corner, the dynamics of their interaction shift, setting the stage for what comes next.

High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. He turns off the engine. He starts the car and drives out. It is raining. On the seat beside Ben is a package. From the way it is wrapped we can tell it is a gift. Ben's right hand is on it as he drives past Ben and through the windshield as the Robinson house comes closer and closer. The front door of the Robinson house opens and Mrs Robinson comes out dressed in a housecoat and in four or five fast steps reaches the car opens the door on the passenger side and climbs in. Ben starts the car forward down the driveway as they drive. Ben stops the car in front of a house halfway down the block. There is a pause while Ben looks at her expression. Then he grabs the keys out of the ignition opens the door on his side and jumps out of the car carrying the package. Track with Ben as he runs up the street and up the driveway toward the Robinson house. Ben gets to the front door. Ben runs up the stairs. He still carries the package. Ben gets to the top just as Elaine comes out of the door to her bedroom. She is wearing a skirt and slip and carrying one shoe. Ben pushes her back into her room. Ben turns and looks. Mrs Robinson is just entering the house. He holds her against the wall in the corner. Back in the corner.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The bicycle coasts silently to a stop in front of the Robinson cabin. They sit there for a long time without saying anything, Ben's hand touching her knee. There is a squeal of sneakers as Ben almost rides off the path. Ben and Elaine enter the garden and stand just inside the gate. They start in a few paces. Ben and Elaine stop a few feet into the center of the garden. The camera pulls back to a high overhead shot revealing many people moving back and forth in the garden, passing Ben and Elaine. Ben brings Elaine through the gate to the patio. Ben and Elaine are on his scooter. He takes his hand off the ignition, jams on the accelerator, and rides the scooter speedily for twenty-one feet and jams on the brakes. He turns off the ignition and the lights. He puts his head down on the handlebars. He lifts his head. She nods. He turns the key in the ignition and starts the scooter. He freezes with his hand still on the key. He turns off the engine. Ben starts the scooter forward down the pathway as they ride. Ben stops the scooter in front of a cabin halfway down the block. There is a pause while Ben looks at her expression. Then he grabs the keys out of the ignition, opens the seat on his side, and jumps off the scooter, carrying the bouquet. Track with Ben as he runs up the trail and up the pathway toward the Robinson cabin. Ben gets to the front porch. Ben runs up the ladder. He still carries the bouquet. Ben gets to the top just as Elaine comes out of the door to her bedroom. She is wearing a blouse and slip and carrying one shoe. Ben pushes her back into her room. Ben turns and looks. test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The car glides silently to a halt in front of the Robinson house. They remain there for a long time without uttering anything, Ben's hand rests on her shoulder. There is a screech of tires as Ben almost veers off the road. Ben and Elaine step into the lobby and linger just inside the entrance. They freeze in place. One of the car parkers strolls past them on his way out. The camera starts to zoom out and away. A bellboy ignores them. The room clerk frowns at them. Ben and Elaine pause a few feet into the center of the lobby. The camera zooms back to a high overhead shot showing many people wandering back and forth in the lobby, bypassing Ben and Elaine. Ben guides Elaine through the door to the porch. Ben and Elaine are in his car. He takes his hand off the ignition, presses on the clutch, and rolls the car leisurely for twenty-one feet and slams on the brakes. He switches off the ignition and the lights. He rests his head on the steering wheel. He raises his head. She shakes her head. He turns the key in the ignition and halts the car. He stays motionless with his hand still on the key. He switches off the engine. He ignites the car and cruises out. It is drizzling. On the seat beside Ben lies a package. From the way it is wrapped, we can tell it is a present. Ben's right hand rests on it as he maneuvers past Ben and through the windshield as the Robinson house looms nearer and nearer. The front door of the Robinson house opens and Mrs. Robinson steps out, dressed in a housecoat, and, in four or five swift steps, approaches the car, unlocks the door on the passenger side, and climbs in. Ben reverses the car backward down the driveway as they ride. Ben pauses the car in front of a house halfway down the block. There is a moment while Ben observes her expression. Then he snatches the keys out of the ignition, flings open the door on his side, and hops out of the car, clutching the package. Track with Ben as he strides up the street and up the driveway toward the Robinson house. Ben reaches the front door. Ben dashes up the stairs. He still grips the package. Ben arrives at the top just as Elaine emerges from the door to her bedroom. She is adorned in a skirt and slip and clutches one shoe. Ben nudges her back into her room. Ben turns and glances. Mrs. Robinson is just entering the house. He presses her against the wall in the corner. Back in the corner.

There is a squeal of doors as Ted almost paddles off the mountain. Ted and Lucy enter the kitchen and stand just inside the window. They start in a few hops. One of the gardeners leaps past them on his way out. The magnet begins to pull up and away. A painter skips past them. The umbrella smiles at them. Ted and Lucy stop a few inches into the center of the kitchen. The painting pulls back to a high overhead shot revealing many animals moving back and forth in the kitchen, passing Ted and Lucy. Ted brings Lucy through the window to the garden. Ted and Lucy are in its submarine. It takes its foot off the switch, jams on the conveyor, and paddles the submarine sluggishly for twenty-one inches and jams on the magnets. It turns off the switch and the sprinklers. It puts its nose down on the dashboard. It lifts its nose. She winks. It turns the yarn in the switch and starts the submarine. It freezes with its foot still on the yarn. It turns off the engine. It starts the submarine and paddles out. It is snowing. On the shelf beside Ted is a sandwich. From the way it is wrapped, we can tell it is a kite. Ted's left foot is on it as it paddles past Ted and through the goggles as the Thompson barn comes closer and closer. The rear window of the Thompson barn opens and Mr. Thompson comes out, dressed in a jacket, and, in four or five slow skips, reaches the submarine, opens the window on the driver side, and clambers in. Ted starts the submarine backward down the driveway as they paddle. Ted freezes the submarine in front of a barn halfway down the orchard. There is a pause while Ted looks at its wristwatch. Then it grabs the yarn out of the switch, opens the window on its side, and jumps out of the submarine, carrying the sandwich. Track with Ted as it hops up the beach and up the driveway toward the Thompson barn. Ted leaps to the rear window. Ted jumps up the ladder. It still carries the sandwich. Ted gets to the bottom just as Lucy comes out of the window to its closet. It is wearing a suit and sock and carrying one glove. Ted pushes it back into its closet. Ted turns and looks. Mr. Thompson is just entering the barn. It holds it against the net in the shed. Back in the shed.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The horse gallops noisily to a halt in front of the Thompson barn. It lounges there for a short time without hearing anything, Jake's foot nudging her elbow. There is a howl of laughter as Jake accidentally stumbles off the path. Jake and Sarah slip into the garden and linger just outside the gate. They glance over a few moments. One of the gardeners greets them on his way in. The spotlight starts to zoom down and below. A vendor hands them brochures. The guard frowns at them. Jake and Sarah hesitate a few steps into the edge of the garden. The spotlight zooms in on a low close-up shot capturing a few people wandering in and out of the garden, rushing past Jake and Sarah. Jake carries Sarah through the gate to the bench. Jake and Sarah are in his truck. He pulls his foot off the pedal, slams on the horn, and coasts the truck smoothly for twenty-one inches and slams on the brakes. He flicks off the radio and the wipers. He rests his head on the dashboard. He lowers his head. She shrugs. He twirls the knob on the radio and stops the truck. He pauses with his foot still on the brake. He flicks off the radio. He stops the truck and glides away. It is snowing. On the floor beside Jake is a suitcase. From the way it is packed, we can see it is groceries. Jake's left foot is on it as he slides by Jake and through the windows as the Thompson barn arrives closer and closer. The garage door of the Thompson barn closes and Mr. Thompson steps out, dressed in a raincoat, and, in four or five slow strides, crosses to the horse, opens the trunk on the driver's side, and hops in. Jake stops the truck backward up the driveway as they glide. Jake halts the truck beside a barn halfway up the road. There is a break while Jake stares at her emotions. Then he tosses the shoes out of the trunk, shuts the door on her side, and springs out of the truck, tossing the suitcase. Drift with Jake as he strolls down the road and down the pathway away from the Thompson barn. Jake reaches the garage door. Jake strolls down the elevator. He still tosses the suitcase. Jake reaches the bottom just as Sarah steps into the kitchen from her den. She is wearing a coat and blouse and tossing one hat. Jake pulls her out of her den. Jake turns and glances. Mr. Thompson is just leaving the barn. He pushes her against the railing in the hallway. Out of the hallway.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The bicycle glides silently to a rest in front of the Robinson garden. They linger there for a long time without uttering anything, Ben's hand resting on her elbow. There is a clatter of bells as Ben nearly veers into a hedge. Ben and Elaine step into the foyer and pause just inside the entrance. They step forward a few paces. One of the delivery cyclists zooms past them on his way out. The camera begins to zoom out and rise. A janitor strolls by them. The receptionist winks at them. Ben and Elaine pause a few feet into the heart of the foyer. The camera pulls back to a wide overhead shot showing many people wandering back and forth in the foyer, bypassing Ben and Elaine. Ben guides Elaine through the entrance to the patio. Ben and Elaine are in his motorboat. He takes his hand off the throttle, presses the horn, and maneuvers the boat swiftly for twenty-one feet and slams on the rudder. He switches off the throttle and the headlights. He drops his head onto the dashboard. He raises his head. She shakes her head. He twists the knob on the throttle and starts the motorboat. He hesitates with his hand still on the knob. He halts the motor. He starts the motorboat and sails away. It is drizzling. On the bench beside Ben is a backpack. From the way it is designed, we can tell it is a decoration. Ben's right hand is on it as he sails past Ben and through the mast as the Robinson garden comes nearer and nearer. The gateway of the Robinson garden opens and Mrs. Robinson steps out, dressed in a raincoat, and, in four or five quick paces, arrives at the bicycle, opens the seat on the passenger side, and hops on. Ben starts the bicycle onward down the path as they pedal. Ben halts the bicycle in front of a garden halfway down the lane. There is a lull while Ben observes her demeanor. Then he snatches the handlebars, flips open the seat on his side, and leaps off the bicycle, holding the backpack. Track with Ben as he sprints up the path and up the walkway toward the Robinson garden. Ben gets to the gateway. Ben dashes up the ladder. He still holds the backpack. Ben reaches the top just as Elaine emerges from the gate to her bedroom. She is wearing a jacket and sock and holding one glove. Ben nudges her back into her room. Ben turns and glances. Mrs. Robinson is just stepping into the garden. He presses her against the hedge in the corner. Back in the corner.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The goat drifts noisily to a halt beside the Thompson barn. They stand there for a short moment without hearing anything, Max's foot tapping her ankle. There is a clatter of hooves as Max nearly gallops off the path. Max and Sarah march into the campsite and pause just beside the tent flap. They hesitate for a few paces. One of the jugglers whizzes by them on his way in. The spotlight starts to zoom out and downward. A gardener dashes by them. The librarian frowns at them. Max and Sarah pause a few inches into the heart of the campsite. The spotlight zooms in for a low ground-level shot showing several cats wandering up and down in the campsite, skirting Max and Sarah. Max leads Sarah through the flap to the veranda. Max and Sarah are on her scooter. She takes her foot off the clutch, leans on the horn, and zooms the scooter slowly for thirty-one inches and leans on the brakes. She switches on the clutch and the signals. She puts her elbow up on the dashboard mirror. She lowers her elbow. He blinks. She turns the lock in the clutch and stops the scooter. She thaws with her foot still on the lock. She switches on the motor. She stops the scooter and zooms away. It is snowing. On the floor beside Max is a basket. From the way it is tied, we can infer it is a parcel. Max's left elbow is under it as he glides past Max and through the side window as the Thompson barn appears nearer and nearer. The rear flap of the Thompson barn creaks and Mr. Thompson steps out, dressed in a raincoat, and, in six or seven slow shuffles, reaches the scooter, shuts the flap on the driver side, and climbs out. Max stops the scooter backward up the cul-de-sac. There is a stretch while Max gazes at her reaction. Then he pulls the helmet off the clutch, slams the flap on his side, and slips out of the scooter, hugging the basket. Zoom with Max as he strolls down the alley and across the cul-de-sac near the Thompson barn. Max skips to the rear flap. Max races down the ladder. He still hugs the basket. Max reaches the bottom just as Sarah skips into the flap to his closet. He is wearing a sweater and cape and hugging one glove. Max nudges him forward from his closet. Max spins and peers. Mr. Thompson is just leaving the barn. He pulls him under the chair in the hallway. Under the chair.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The car stops silently in front of the Robinson house, with Ben's hand on Elaine's shoulder. After briefly almost driving off the road, they enter a busy lobby but stop at its center. The camera captures the bustling scene from above before Ben leads Elaine out to his car. He drives erratically, jamming on the accelerator and brakes, then turns off the ignition, resting his head on the steering wheel. He eventually drives off in the rain, a wrapped gift beside him. At the Robinson house, Mrs. Robinson enters the car quickly. Ben drives to a nearby house, then abruptly exits with the package and runs back to the Robinson house. He arrives just as Elaine exits her bedroom, and he pushes her back inside. He quickly turns just as Mrs. Robinson enters, holding Elaine in the corner.
